stories.title: Y Combinator: The Institute of Innovation

stories.text:
Hi, I'm an extremely lazy business owner that sells a popular consumer product. There are a lot of promoters and advocates who reach out via email who love my product and are always trying to partner and collaborate with me; yet usually when I am quickly going through emails I am way too lazy to open a CRM and create an entry for them. So a lot of them fall through the cracks.

What I want is a CRM that integrates very nicely with email. I don't ever want to leave my inbox; so I would like to be able to do something like forward the email to some address like noreply@mycrm.com and include some maybe structured data that the crm knows how to interpret and create an entry for. A bonus would to have it similarly integrated with other customer touch points like IG/FB.

Maybe it could just pipe it to google sheets or zapier for further processing. Anything like this exist? If it doesn't, I would like to build it. I really need it; maybe others do too. Thank you.
stories.title: Ask HN: Best CRM that can be completely managed from an inbox?
Light as a fairy tale: What makes a feel-good film feel good?
Geico may have to pay $5.2M to a woman who got an STD in an insured car

stories.text: I said what I said. All the hipster apps that allow you to put stickys on a board to manage progress are missing the point. Tasks to do tasks dont necessarily lead you to accomplishing your goals. I built a tool with my team that makes users align all work to their goals. No way around it. We call them missions. Let me know your thoughts! Roast it, love it, be confused by it...let us know! https://twigflo.com

stories.text:
Hello HN.

I am a somewhat experienced developer and I have five days coming up where I would like to focus on building an income stream.

There is a lot I have on mind but I am sure there is a lot I don't know that I don't know.

What do you suggest I build that I can build in five days that can become an income stream. Did you do something that worked well?
stories.title: Ask HN: Money in Five Days?
